trans-unit.source: option to the set builtin is enabled (see The Set Builtin), the shell provides access to the command history, the list of commands previously typed. The value of the HISTSIZE shell variable is used as the number of commands to save in a history list. The text of the last $HISTSIZE commands (default 500) is saved. The shell stores each command in the history list prior to parameter and variable expansion but after history expansion is performed, subject to the values of the shell variables HISTIGNORE and HISTCONTROL.

option to the set builtin is enabled (see The Set Builtin), the shell provides access to the command history, the list of commands previously typed. The value of the HISTSIZE shell variable is used as the number of commands to save in a history list. The text of the last $HISTSIZE commands (default 500) is saved. The shell stores each command in the history list prior to parameter and variable expansion but after history expansion is performed, subject to the values of the shell variables HISTIGNORE and HISTCONTROL.
trans-unit.target: La opción para el set integrado está habilitada (consulte El conjunto integrado ), el shell proporciona acceso al historial de comandos , la lista de comandos previamente escritos. El valor de la variable de shell HISTSIZE se usa como el número de comandos para guardar en una lista de historial. Se guarda el texto de los últimos comandos $HISTSIZE (predeterminado 500). El shell almacena cada comando en la lista del historial antes de la expansión de parámetros y variables, pero después de que se realiza la expansión del historial, sujeto a los valores de las variables de shell HISTIGNORE e HISTCONTROL .

trans-unit.source: option to the set builtin is enabled, Bash reports such changes immediately (see The Set Builtin). Any trap on SIGCHLD is executed for each child process that exits.
option to the set builtin is enabled, Bash reports such changes immediately (see The Set Builtin). Any trap on SIGCHLD is executed for each child process that exits.
trans-unit.target: la opción para el set integrado está habilitada, Bash informa dichos cambios de inmediato (consulte El conjunto integrado ). Cualquier trampa en SIGCHLD se ejecuta para cada proceso secundario que salga.

trans-unit.source: option, alias prints the list of aliases on the standard output in a form that allows them to be reused as input. If arguments are supplied, an alias is defined for each name whose value is given. If no value is given, the name and value of the alias is printed. Aliases are described in Aliases.

option, alias prints the list of aliases on the standard output in a form that allows them to be reused as input. If arguments are supplied, an alias is defined for each name whose value is given. If no value is given, the name and value of the alias is printed. Aliases are described in Aliases.
trans-unit.target: opción, alias imprime la lista de alias en la salida estándar en una forma que les permite ser reutilizados como entrada. Si se proporcionan argumentos, se define un alias para cada name cuyo value se proporciona. Si no se proporciona ningún value , se imprime el nombre y el valor del alias. Los alias se describen en Alias .

trans-unit.source: option, split into words as described above in Word Splitting, and the first word is assigned to the first name, the second word to the second name, and so on. If there are more words than names, the remaining words and their intervening delimiters are assigned to the last name. If there are fewer words read from the input stream than names, the remaining names are assigned empty values. The characters in the value of the IFS variable are used to split the line into words using the same rules the shell uses for expansion (described above in Word Splitting). The backslash character ‘

option, split into words as described above in Word Splitting, and the first word is assigned to the first name, the second word to the second name, and so on. If there are more words than names, the remaining words and their intervening delimiters are assigned to the last name. If there are fewer words read from the input stream than names, the remaining names are assigned empty values. The characters in the value of the IFS variable are used to split the line into words using the same rules the shell uses for expansion (described above in Word Splitting). The backslash character ‘
trans-unit.target: opción, dividir en palabras como se describió anteriormente en Separación de palabras , y la primera palabra se asigna al primer name , la segunda palabra al segundo name , y así sucesivamente. Si hay más palabras que nombres, las palabras restantes y sus delimitadores intermedios se asignan al name . Si se leen menos palabras de la secuencia de entrada que nombres, a los nombres restantes se les asignan valores vacíos. Los caracteres en el valor de la variable IFS se usan para dividir la línea en palabras usando las mismas reglas que el shell usa para la expansión (descrito anteriormente en Word Splitting ). El carácter de barra diagonal inversa '

trans-unit.source: option, when job control is enabled, forces wait to wait for each pid or jobspec to terminate before returning its status, intead of returning when it changes status. If neither jobspec nor pid specifies an active child process of the shell, the return status is 127.
trans-unit.target: opción, cuando el control de trabajo está habilitado, obliga a wait a esperar que cada pid o jobspec de trabajo finalice antes de devolver su estado, en lugar de regresar cuando cambia de estado. Si ni jobspec ni pid especifican un proceso secundario activo del shell, el estado de retorno es 127.

trans-unit.source: option, will alter its real and effective <small>UID</small> and <small>GID</small> if they are less than some magic threshold value, commonly 100. This can lead to unexpected results.
trans-unit.target: opción, alterará su <small>UID</small> y <small>GID</small> real y efectivo si son inferiores a algún valor de umbral mágico, comúnmente 100. Esto puede conducir a resultados inesperados.

trans-unit.source: option. This sets the default value of the xpg_echo shell option to on, which makes the Bash echo behave more like the version specified in the Single Unix Specification, version 3. See Bash Builtins, for a description of the escape sequences that echo recognizes.

option. This sets the default value of the xpg_echo shell option to on, which makes the Bash echo behave more like the version specified in the Single Unix Specification, version 3. See Bash Builtins, for a description of the escape sequences that echo recognizes.
trans-unit.target: opción. Esto establece el valor predeterminado de la opción de shell xpg_echo en on , lo que hace que el echo Bash se comporte más como la versión especificada en la Especificación de Unix Único, versión 3. Consulte Bash Builtins , para obtener una descripción de las secuencias de escape que el echo reconoce.

options are added to each member of the completion list, and the result is returned to the Readline completion code as the list of possible completions.

trans-unit.source: options enabled at invocation (either by default or with command-line arguments) or by set
trans-unit.target: opciones habilitadas en la invocación (ya sea de forma predeterminada o con argumentos de línea de comandos) o por set

trans-unit.source: options enabled by shopt (see The Shopt Builtin)

options is invoked. When the command or function is invoked, the COMP_LINE, COMP_POINT, COMP_KEY, and COMP_TYPE variables are assigned values as described above (see Bash Variables). If a shell function is being invoked, the COMP_WORDS and COMP_CWORD variables are also set. When the function or command is invoked, the first argument ($1) is the name of the command whose arguments are being completed, the second argument ($2) is the word being completed, and the third argument ($3) is the word preceding the word being completed on the current command line. No filtering of the generated completions against the word being completed is performed; the function or command has complete freedom in generating the matches.

options is invoked. When the command or function is invoked, the COMP_LINE, COMP_POINT, COMP_KEY, and COMP_TYPE variables are assigned values as described above (see Bash Variables). If a shell function is being invoked, the COMP_WORDS and COMP_CWORD variables are also set. When the function or command is invoked, the first argument ($1) is the name of the command whose arguments are being completed, the second argument ($2) is the word being completed, and the third argument ($3) is the word preceding the word being completed on the current command line. No filtering of the generated completions against the word being completed is performed; the function or command has complete freedom in generating the matches.
trans-unit.target: Se invoca opciones. Cuando se invoca el comando o la función, a las COMP_LINE , COMP_POINT , COMP_KEY y COMP_TYPE se les asignan valores como se describió anteriormente (ver Variables Bash ). Si se invoca una función de shell, COMP_WORDS y COMP_CWORD También se establecen variables. Cuando se invoca la función o comando, el primer argumento ($ 1) es el nombre del comando cuyos argumentos se están completando, el segundo argumento ($ 2) es la palabra que se está completando y el tercer argumento ($ 3) es la palabra que precede al palabra completada en la línea de comando actual. No se realiza el filtrado de las finalizaciones generadas contra la palabra que se está completando; la función o comando tiene total libertad para generar las coincidencias.

trans-unit.source: that should be read when the shell needs to complete a hostname. The list of possible hostname completions may be changed while the shell is running; the next time hostname completion is attempted after the value is changed, Bash adds the contents of the new file to the existing list. If HOSTFILE is set, but has no value, or does not name a readable file, Bash attempts to read
trans-unit.target: eso debería leerse cuando el shell necesita completar un nombre de host. trans-unit.source: where each value is of the form [subscript]=string. Indexed array assignments do not require anything but string. Indexing starts at zero.

trans-unit.source: will abort an incremental search and restore the original line. When the search is terminated, the history entry containing the search string becomes the current line.
trans-unit.target: abortará una búsqueda incremental y restaurará la línea original.Cuando se termina la búsqueda,la entrada del historial que contiene la cadena de búsqueda se convierte en la línea actual.

trans-unit.source: will ensure that the output of traceroute foss.org.my is displayed first.

trans-unit.source: will evaluate the commands using the shell (since no explicit command is supplied as an argument), in blocks of ten shell jobs at a time.
trans-unit.target: evaluará los comandos usando el shell (ya que no se suministra ningún comando explícito como argumento),en bloques de diez trabajos de shell a la vez.
